page.title: 12LANDSCAPE _ CLEE HILL AREA
page.content:
From Hill Top in the NE. of our area, there is a spectacular view of { {Clee Hill}village and all of our rural area. Most of our area is farmland, with some common land and deciduous woodland. There are stone walls and fences to separate the fields. Sheep and cattle graze in some of the fields. Houses are dotted about the country_side. The traffic seems to move slowly and quietly on the main road.
The North of our area is higher land _ the highest part is approximately 430 metres above sea level.{Clee Hill}village is situated at 375 metres. The land slopes down to {Knowbury}_ at 260 metres _{Whitton {Court}_ at 170 metres _ and{Hope {Bagot }_ at 180 metres.
